THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY.  THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW ITS GRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.  IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND VICTIM SERVICES ORGANIZATIONS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, SUCH AS FAITH- AND COMMUNITY- BASED ORGANIZATIONS.

THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (IACP) IS THE LARGEST LAW ENFORCEMENT ORGANIZATION WORLDWIDE. THE 123-YEAR-OLD ORGANIZATION IS COMPRISED OF OVER 25,000 LAW ENFORCEMENT EXECUTIVES FROM OVER ONE HUNDRED COUNTRIES WITH A VISION TO SERVE THE LAW ENFORCEMENT LEADERS OF TODAY AND DEVELOP THE LEADERS OF TOMORROW, AND A MISSION OF ADVANCING THE LAW ENFORCEMENT PROFESSION THROUGH ADVOCACY, OUTREACH, EDUCATION, AND PROGRAMS. THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE HAS EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IN PROVIDING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LAW ENFORCEMENT LEADERSHIP AND THESE EFFORTS HAVE LONG LASTING IMPACT ON ISSUES RELATED TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, DATING VIOLENCE AND STALKING.  IN RECENT YEARS, IACP AND THEIR PARTNERS HAVE WORKED ON ISSUES RELATING TO BODY WORN CAMERAS, GENDER BIAS ROUNDTABLE, LEADERSHIP, MID-LEVEL AND 1ST LINE SUPERVISOR TRAINING AS IT RELATES TO VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN ISSUES, TRAUMA INFORMED SEXUAL ASSAULT, ROLL CALL TRAINING FOR DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND THE NATIONAL CAMPUS LAW ENFORCEMENT SUMMIT. 

WITH THIS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT AWARD, IACP WILL IMPLEMENT THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE TO PREVENT GENDER BIAS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE TO SEXUAL ASSAULT AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE. SPECIFICALLY, IACP WILL:  1) CONDUCT PRESENTATIONS AT FIVE STATEWIDE LAW ENFORCEMENT LEADERSHIP CONFERENCES ON THE GENDER BIAS ASSESSMENT PROGRAM; 2) HOLD THREE HOUR-LONG WEBINARS TO PROMOTE THE NEED FOR ASSESSMENT; 3) CONVENE A STRATEGIC PLANNING PARTNERS MEETING; 4) DEVELOP AN APPLICATION FOR AGENCIES TO COMPLETE IN ORDER DEMONSTRATE COMMITMENT AND READINESS TO ENGAGE IN THE ASSESSMENT PROCESS; AND 5) CONVENE SIX TO EIGHT AGENCY OR REGIONAL ON-SITE TRAININGS RELATED TO GENDER BIAS. 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 36 MONTHS.

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY.  THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW ITS GRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.  IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND VICTIM SERVICES ORGANIZATIONS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, SUCH AS FAITH- AND COMMUNITY- BASED ORGANIZATIONS.

FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE IS A NATIONAL NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH OFFICES IN SAN FRANCISCO, BOSTON, AND DC. FOR OVER 30 YEARS FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE HAS BEEN DEVELOPING PROJECTS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PROMOTE LEADERSHIP AND SUSTAINABILITY WITHIN DIVERSE COMMUNITIES ADDRESSING VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN ISSUES. IN 2010, FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE WAS CHOSEN TO BE THE LEAD TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDER FOR U. S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE ENGAGING MEN PROGRAM, A NATIONAL GRANT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS IN ENGAGING MEN IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE HAS CREATED SEVERAL NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED AND RESPECTED PROGRAMS SUCH AS COACHING BOYS INTO MEN, AN EVIDENCE-BASED COMPREHENSIVE VIOLENCE PREVENTION CURRICULUM. FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE IS A TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDER FOR SEVERAL OVW INITIATIVES INCLUDING THE WORKPLACES RESPOND TO DOMESTIC AND SEXUAL VIOLENCE RESOURCE CENTER, AND SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONAL SUSTAINABILITY INSTITUTE TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. 

WITH THIS TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT, FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE WILL SUPPORT THE CAPACITY AND DEVELOPMENT OF OVW CAMPUS GRANTEES AND STOP SUB-GRANTEES TO ENGAGE COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY STAFF, FACULTY, AND STUDENTS INVOLVED WITH FRATERNITIES AND THE RESERVE OFFICERS TRAINING CORPS (ROTC) THROUGH THE MODEL MAN LEADERSHIP PROJECT. SPECIFICALLY, FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE WILL: 1) CONDUCT A LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS TO REVIEW AND IDENTIFY CURRENT CAMPUS PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON ENGAGING MEN IN CAMPUS FRATERNITIES AND ROTC; 2) CONDUCT ASSESSMENTS OF KEY CAMPUS STAKEHOLDERS TO DETERMINE THE NEEDS OF FRATERNITIES AND  ROTC IN ADDRESSING PREVENTION OF GENDER-BASED VIOLENCE; 3) REVISE, ENHANCE, AND CREATE CURRICULA BASED ON THE OUTCOMES OF THE LANDSCAPE ANALYSIS AND NEEDS ASSESSMENT TO ADDRESS ENGAGING CAMPUS FRATERNITIES AND ROTC IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN; 4) DEVELOP AND DISSEMINATE PUBLIC EDUCATION MATERIALS WITH INPUT FROM THE TARGET AUDIENCE, FRATERNITIES AND ROTC;  5) PROVIDE 5-7  INTERACTIVE TRAININGS OF THE MODEL MAN LEADERSHIP PROJECT TO CAMPUS FRATERNITIES AND ROTC; 6) CONDUCT A PROGRAM ASSESSMENT OF THE MODEL MAN LEADERSHIP PROJECT AND PROVIDE A WRITTEN REPORT OF THE FINDINGS TO OVW; 7) CONDUCT 2-4 WEBINARS FOCUSED ON ENGAGING CAMPUS FRATERNITIES AND ROTC IN CAMPUS PREVENTION STRATEGIES AND ACTIVITIES; 8) COLLABORATE WITH OVW TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MODEL MAN LEADERSHIP PROJECT AND OTHER TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS, WHEN REQUESTED, SUCH AS THE CAMPUS PROGRAM TRAINING INSTITUTES; 9) PROVIDE ONGOING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO OVW GRANTEES, SUB-GRANTEES, AND NON-GRANTEES AS IDENTIFIED BY OVW, INCLUDING THE CAMPUS PROGRAM TRAINING INSTITUTES; AND 10) PROVIDE 3-6 ON-SITE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE VISITS FOR CAMPUSES.

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 36 MONTHS.

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY.  THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW ITS GRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.  IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE AND VICTIM SERVICES ORGANIZATIONS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN, SUCH AS FAITH- AND COMMUNITY- BASED ORGANIZATIONS.

FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE (FUTURES) IS A NATIONAL, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH OFFICES IN SAN FRANCISCO, BOSTON, AND THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA. FOR OVER 30 YEARS FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE HAS BEEN DEVELOPING PROJECTS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PROMOTE LEADERSHIP AND SUSTAINABILITY WITHIN DIVERSE COMMUNITIES ADDRESSING VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN ISSUES. FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE HAS CREATED SEVERAL NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED AND RESPECTED PROGRAMS SUCH AS COACHING BOYS INTO MEN, AN EVIDENCE-BASED COMPREHENSIVE VIOLENCE PREVENTION CURRICULUM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BREAK THE CYCLE (BTC).  IN 2010, FUTURES WITHOUT VIOLENCE WAS CHOSEN TO BE THE LEAD TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDER FOR U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE ENGAGING MEN PROGRAM, A NATIONAL GRANT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT ORGANIZATIONS IN ENGAGING MEN IN THE PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. 

THROUGH THIS AWARD, FUTURES WILL: 1) FOSTER AN INTERGENERATIONAL COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE THROUGH THE CREATION OF A YOUTH STEERING COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF ADVOCATES AND YOUTH LEADERS IN ORDER TO INVEST YOUNG PEOPLE IN LEADING ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE BY STRENGTHENING THEIR ROLE AS PEER EDUCATORS; 2) CREATE AND DISTRIBUTE TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO THE BROAD FIELD OF YOUTH AND ADULT ADVOCATES; 3) PROVIDE TARGETED TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WITH DISTINCT TRACKS AND GOALS FOR YOUTH AND ADULT ALLIES TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY TO PRACTICE AND MODEL THEIR TRAININGS AND FOR PEER TO PEER EXCHANGES; 4) PROVIDE ONGOING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO OVW GRANTEES BY ASSISTING WITH ACTION PLAN DEVELOPMENT; 5) DEVELOP A CURRICULUM TOOLKIT FOR BOTH ADULT ALLIES AND YOUTH LEADERS; 6) CREATE A RESOURCE TOOLKIT FOR ADULT ALLIES AND YOUTH LEADERS; 7) HOST A WEBINAR SERIES ON TOPICS SUCH AS - SEX TRAFFICKING, THE SCHOOL TO PRISON PIPELINE, AND ISSUES AFFECTING LGBTQ YOUTH, NATIVE YOUTH, IMMIGRANT YOUTH; AND 8) INCREASE YOUTH ORGANIZING CAPACITY THROUGH RESOURCE SHARING VIA YOUTUBE OR PODCASTS BY CREATING A YOUTH SERIES FOCUSED ON PREVENTING SEXUAL ASSAULT, DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE AND STALKING.

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

IN FY 2022, OVW FUNDED SITES TO PARTICIPATE IN THE FIREARMS TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE INITIATIVE PROJECT (FTAP) WITH THE GOAL OF HELPING COMMUNITIES IDENTIFY CHALLENGES TO IMPLEMENTATION OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE FIREARMS LAWS IN THEIR JURISDICTIONS AND ASSISTING THEM IN ESTABLISHING A LOCALIZED RESPONSE THAT IS BEST SUITED TO THEIR COMMUNITIES’ UNIQUE NEEDS AND CHARACTERISTICS. THROUGH THE FTAP TTA, OVW SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE NEEDS OF THE SITES TO ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE COMMUNITY’S RESPONSE TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE CASES INVOLVING FIREARMS. 

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT UJIMA INC., THE NATIONAL CENTER ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN IN THE BLACK COMMUNITY  IN PROVIDING TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON ADDRESSING HOMICIDE PREVENTION AND LOCAL, STATE, TRIBAL, AND FEDERAL FIREARMS POLICIES AND LAWS THROUGH A CULTURAL CONTEXT OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE IN VARIOUS TRADITIONALLY MARGINALIZED AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVE PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO OVW FIREARMS PROJECT PILOT SITES, AS WELL AS COLLABORATING WITH THE OVW FUNDED DOMESTIC VIOLENCE HOMICIDE TA RESOURCE CENTER AND THE COMPETITIVELY SELECTED FTAP TA PROVIDER. 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

THIS IS A CONTINUATION AWARD.

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY. THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW CURRENT AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE CRIMINAL AND CIVIL JUSTICE SYSTEMS AND VICTIM SERVICES PROVIDERS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.

 

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT FY 2022 TA INITIATIVE PURPOSE AREA 61, TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO EXISTING AND POTENTIAL TRIBAL COALITIONS TO ADDRESS DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, STALKING, AND SEX TRAFFICKING.

 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT FY 2022 TA INITIATIVE PURPOSE AREA 27, TO PROVIDE SPECIALIZED TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO ENHANCE AND BUILD THE CAPACITY OF COMMUNITIES SERVING LARGE MILITARY POPULATIONS TO RESPOND TO CASES OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING INVOLVING MILITARY PERSONNEL (ACTIVE DUTY AND VETERANS) AND THEIR FAMILIES. THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THAT RECOGNIZES THE COMPLEXITIES AND ROLES OF CIVILIAN AND MILITARY CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEMS AS WELL AS THE LEGAL PRACTITIONERS WHO SERVE SERVICE MEMBERS, VETERANS, AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO INCLUDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR CIVILIAN LAW ENFORCEMENT, PROSECUTION, COURTS, PRE-TRIAL SERVICES, PROBATION AND PAROLE OFFICERS, AND ADVOCATES ON WORKING WITH MILITARY PERSONNEL AND FAMILIES, AS WELL AS TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING FOR VETERAN COURTS AND SIMILAR COURT PROGRAMS.

 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 36 MONTHS.

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY. THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW CURRENT AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE CRIMINAL AND CIVIL JUSTICE SYSTEMS AND VICTIM SERVICES PROVIDERS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.

 

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT FY 2022 TA INITIATIVE PURPOSE AREA 41, TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SUPPORT LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN IMPLEMENTING POLICIES, PRACTICES, AND TRAINING ALIGNED WITH THE PRINCIPLES SET FORTH IN THE JUSTICE DEPARTMENT’S IDENTIFYING AND PREVENTING GENDER BIAS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE TO SEXUAL ASSAULT AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE GUIDANCE.

 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

 

THIS AWARD IS A NEW AWARD.

THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW CURRENT AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE CRIMINAL AND CIVIL JUSTICE SYSTEMS AND VICTIM SERVICES PROVIDERS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.

 

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT FY 2022 TA INITIATIVE PURPOSE AREA 45, TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SPECIALIZED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, RESOURCES, AND TRAININGS FOR GRANTEES AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES OF THE TRIBAL SEXUAL ASSAULT SERVICES PROGRAM AND THE TRIBAL GOVERNMENT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHMENT, MAINTENANCE, AND EXPANSION OF SEXUAL ASSAULT PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE FOR INTERVENTION AND RELATED ASSISTANCE TO THOSE VICTIMIZED BY SEXUAL ASSAULT. THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT SERVICES FOR A BROAD RANGE OF SURVIVORS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT (E.G., ADULTS ABUSED AS CHILDREN, MALE SURVIVORS, CHILD AND YOUTH SURVIVORS, AND TWO-SPIRTED SURVIVORS). 

 

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THE CRIMINAL AND CIVIL JUSTICE SYSTEMS AND VICTIM SERVICES PROVIDERS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT FY 2022 TA INITIATIVE PURPOSE AREA 39, TO DEVELOP, PROMOTE, AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE ON A MODEL PENAL CODE FOR SEXUAL ASSAULT, INCLUDING ISSUES AROUND CONSENT. THE DEVELOPMENT PROCESS WILL INCLUDE A REVIEW OF CURRENT SEXUAL ASSAULT LAWS IN STATES AND TERRITORIES, AND CONSULTATION WITH EXPERTS FROM A VARIETY OF DISCIPLINES, INCLUDING PROSECUTORS, LAW ENFORCEMENT, VICTIM ADVOCATES, AND COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY PROFESSIONALS AS WELL AS EXPERTS ON WORKING WITH CULTURALLY SPECIFIC AND OTHER UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS.

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY. THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW CURRENT AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TTA) SPECIFIC TO GRANTEES AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES OF THE OVW TRIBAL JURISDICTION PROGRAM TO PLAN FOR, IMPLEMENT, AND EXERCISE SPECIAL TRIBAL CRIMINAL JURISDICTION (STCJ). THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES AND TTA FOR TRIBAL LEADERSHIP, JUDGES, COURTS, PROSECUTORS, DEFENSE COUNSEL, LAW ENFORCEMENT, COURT SERVICES, VICTIM ADVOCATES, CHILD WELFARE STAFF, AND OTHER INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PARTNERS WITHIN THE TRIBAL JUSTICE SYSTEM AND COMMUNITY NECESSARY FOR EFFECTIVE AND SUCCESSFUL PLANNING, IMPLEMENTATION, AND EXERCISE OF STCJ. SPECIFIC PROJECT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: CONTINUED SUPPORT FOR THE INTER-TRIBAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE WORKING GROUP (ITWG) INCLUDING IN-PERSON AND/OR VIRTUAL MEETINGS; REGULARLY SCHEDULED DISCIPLINE-SPECIFIC CALLS OR WEBINARS; REGULARLY SCHEDULED TA CALLS FOR TRIBES EXERCISING CRIMINAL JURISDICTION OVER NON-INDIANS; PERIODIC LISTSERV EMAIL UPDATES; INDIVIDUALIZED TTA REGARDING TRIBAL CODES, RULES, AND POLICY AND PROCEDURE DEVELOPMENT; DISCIPLINE-SPECIFIC AND MULTI-DISCIPLINARY TTA; TTA REGARDING THE STCJ COVERED CRIMES; AND A WEBSITE WITH ON-DEMAND STCJ INFORMATION FOR THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND RESOURCES FOR TRIBES THAT ARE PLANNING FOR AND EXERCISING CRIMINAL JURISDICTION OVER NON-INDIANS.

THE TIMING FOR PERFORMANCE OF THIS AWARD IS 24 MONTHS.
VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN ACT MEASURING EFFECTIVENESS INITIATIVE YEAR 5

THE OFFICE ON VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN (OVW) TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TA) INITIATIVE PROVIDES OVW GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES WITH THE EXPERTISE AND SUPPORT THEY NEED TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT SUCCESSFUL STATE, LOCAL, TRIBAL, AND CAMPUS PROJECTS; INCREASE VICTIM SAFETY; AND BOLSTER OFFENDER ACCOUNTABILITY. THROUGH COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS, OVW SUPPORTS EDUCATIONAL INITIATIVES, CONFERENCES, PEER-TO-PEER CONSULTATIONS, AND TARGETED ASSISTANCE THAT ALLOW CURRENT AND POTENTIAL GRANTEES AND SUBGRANTEES TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS AND ONE ANOTHER ABOUT HOW TO OVERCOME OBSTACLES AND INCORPORATE PROMISING PRACTICES IN THEIR EFFORTS TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. IN ADDITION, OVW IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF CRIMINAL AND CIVIL JUSTICE AND VICTIM SERVICES ORGANIZATIONS TO RESPOND EFFECTIVELY TO DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, DATING VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING AND TO FOSTER PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN ORGANIZATIONS THAT HAVE NOT TRADITIONALLY WORKED TOGETHER TO ADDRESS VIOLENCE AGAINST WOMEN. THE NORTHERN ARIZONA UNIVERSITY’S NATIONAL DOMESTIC VIOLENCE FATALITY REVIEW INITIATIVE (NDVFRI) AND CLEARINGHOUSE PROVIDES A COMMUNITY-ORIENTED APPROACH TO REVIEWING DOMESTIC VIOLENCE RELATED HOMICIDES. WITH FY 2022 OVW FUNDING, ARIZONA STATE UNIVERSITY WILL CONTINUE TO IMPLEMENT THE NDVFRI. DURING THE COURSE OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, THE NDVFRI WILL DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN THE NATIONAL CLEARINGHOUSE TO SECURELY COLLECT, TRACK, AND ANALYZE REVIEWS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE (DV) FATALITIES. ADDITIONALLY, NDVFRI WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO OVW GRANTEES TO DEVELOP NDVFRI DOMESTIC VIOLENCE FATALITY REVIEW TEAMS.
